Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located approximately 3 miles south east of Sheffield city centre on City Road. National retailers in the vicinity include KFC and Lloyds Bank. City Road / Eastern Avenue tram stop is approximately 2 minutes’ walk from the unit which allows for direct access into Sheffield city centre.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The leasehold element of the building occupies ground and basement floors. The ground floor comprises a large sales area and customer toilets. The basement provides storage and staff accommodation.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 28/09/2030. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease until 28/09/2030.

Rent
The current passing rent is £21,510, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £11,750.00 and the rates payable are £5,769.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The property is situated in Sheffield City Centre, close to the prime retail pitch, Fargate. The immediate vicinity is principally occupied by offices, bars and restaurants. Surrey Street acts as one of the main thoroughfares between the City Centre and Sheffield Train Station. 
Occupiers nearby include Starbucks, The Head of Steam, The Brown Bear, Ego Restaurant and Wicker Herbal Stores.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground, basement, first and second floors.

Rent
£145,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £126,000.00 and the rates payable are £62,118.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.30p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: A Prime Retail location on a high street with very high footfall.
Opposite Boots, HMV and McDonalds which are positioned on Fargate, the pedestrianised retail heart of the city.
Excellent transport links, being less than a ten minute walk away from the train station as well as having a tram stop outside.
Local occupiers nearby include M&S, Pret, Hotel Chocolat and Topshop.
Separate York Street split also available subject to demand.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Rent
120,000 PAX

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £100,000.00 and the rates payable are £49,300.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.30p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Set on the edge of the  country’s 4th largest  city, Meadowhall is the region’s premier shopping  centre, the catchment  extends from the Peak  District in the west, Hull in the east, Leeds in the  north and to Derby and  Nottingham in the south.

- Average dwell time of 144 minutes.

- Meadowhall's catchment contains 3.2 million people.

- £1.6 billion  physical  comparison goods spend potential.

- 6 million people live within 1 hour’s drive time of Meadowhall.

- Average peak spend of £161.

- Classified as the sixth most affluent Mosaic consumer groups.



KEY BRANDS

River Island, Primark, Apple, Boots (2nd Redesign after Covent Garden), Sports Direct, Footasylum, JD, Virgin Holidays, The Entertainer, Fat Face, Skopes, Barbour, Rituals, Hobbs, TAG, Kurt Geirger, Hugo Boss.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £ and the rates payable are £ pa. The UBR for 2020/2021 is p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property occupies a position on a retail circuit in Kimberworth, approximately 2 miles from Rotherham Centre. The subject unit sits on Ox Close Avenue and comprises several local occupiers. National in the vicinity include McColl's and Post Office. There is nearby public car parking that serves the precinct with convenient nearby bus stops.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground and basement floors comprising a large main sales area, staff accommodation, customer toilets and large storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 14/07/2025. Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £21,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £9,000.00 and the rates payable are £4,491.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Barnsley is a town in South Yorkshire located approximately 12 miles to the north of Sheffield and 21 miles to the south of Leeds.  
Retail in the town centre is focused around Cheapside, Queen Street and The Mall (Alhambra) Shopping Centre. The subject property is located on the pedestrianized Cheapside in a prime location close to the entrance to the town's main shopping centre.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property occupies a first floor unit accessed via a staircase adjacent to the Lloyds Bank frontage.

Tenure
New lease available for a term to be agreed.

Rent
£10,000 pax.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable value of the property is £20,500. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 51.2p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Barnsley Metropolitan Borough is one of the four districts in South Yorkshire,
lying approximately 15 miles north of Sheffield and 20 miles south of Leeds.
The town has excellent links with the M1, the M62 and M18 motorways.
The subject unit itself occupies a position on Peel Square, a short distance from
the ongoing development of the Glass Works Shopping Centre. National
occupiers in the vicinity include Greggs, Yorkshire Bank and Betfred.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises are arranged over ground and first floor. The ground floor
comprises a main sales area, staff accommodation and customer toilets
while the first floor provides storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease
expiring 30/10/2022.
Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £28,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £27,750.00 and the rates payable are £13,847.25 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

The Glass Works, Barnsley is a 500,000 sq ft new town centre retail and leisure scheme providing 25 shops, 10 restaurants including a state of the art 13-screen multiplex cinema and a new Superbowl comprising both bowling lanes and laser quest.  

The Glass Works, Barnsley is a 500,000 sq ft new town centre retail and leisure scheme providing 25 shops, 10 restaurants including a state of the art 13-screen multiplex cinema and a new Superbowl comprising both bowling lanes and laser quest.  

Available units will comprise:

- 4 remaining restaurant units between 2,500 - 5,000 sq ft.

- Retail units of between 200 - 10,000 sq ft

- 2 leisure units of between 6,000 - 15,000 sq ft

Tenure
Leases between 5 and 15 years.

Rent
Rent on application.

Rates
To be assessed.
